items.title: Trump Plans to Pardon Henry Cuellar, Texas Democrat Indicted on Bribery Charges
items.summary: The president used the latest pardon announcement to attack his predecessor, Joseph R. Biden Jr.

items.title: Epstein Files Reveal Private Home Photos in Latest Release by Democrats
items.summary: In publicizing the photos and videos, Democrats in Congress appeared to be intensifying pressure on the Justice Department to release its files on the Epstein case.

items.title: How Is America Changing Under President Trump? We Want to Hear From You.
items.summary: A New York Times reporter wants to hear from you about changes you are seeing in your community since Mr. Trump took office.

items.title: A Progressive Democrat Makes a Long-Shot Senate Bid in Red Kentucky
items.summary: Charles Booker is running again for the chamber as Democrats take chances even in heavily Republican states like Kentucky, where Senator Mitch McConnell is retiring.

items.title: Trump Administration Begins Immigration Operation in New Orleans
items.summary: It is unclear how long the effort will last in Louisiana, where the Republican governor has welcomed the agents with open arms even as immigrant communities fear what might come.

items.title: Hegseth Invoked the ‘Fog of War’ in a Boat Strike. What Does That Mean?
items.summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth used the term, which alludes to uncertainty in battle, in reference to a deadly U.S. military attack in the Caribbean.

items.title: Democrats decry ‘harrowing’ photos of Epstein’s private island home and demand end to Trump’s ‘cover-up’ – live
items.summary: <p>New media release shows Epstein’s home, including several rooms, a telephone, and a chalk board with the words ‘intellectual,’ ‘deception’ and ‘power’</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/03/epstein-caribbean-island-new-photo-video-release">House Democrats release new images of Epstein’s private Caribbean island</a></p></li></ul><p>The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced it had <strong>started its immigration enforcement operation in New Orleans today</strong>.</p><p>In a statement, the department said <strong>Operation Catahoula Crunch</strong> would target “criminal illegal aliens roaming free thanks to sanctuary policies”. New Orleans is the latest Democratic-run city (albeit in a Republican-led state) to see federal immigration agents on its streets. Most recently, the Trump administration targeted Charlotte, North Carolina, and touted the arrest of more than 300 undocumented immigrants.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/dec/03/donald-trump-somali-immigrants-ice-minnesota-pete-hegseth-caribbean-boats-venezuela-us-politics-live-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: House Democrats release new images of Epstein’s private Caribbean island
items.summary: <p>Images and videos taken in 2020, a year after he died in jail, show the late sex offender’s home</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/dec/03/donald-trump-somali-immigrants-ice-minnesota-pete-hegseth-caribbean-boats-venezuela-us-politics-live-latest-news-updates">US politics – live updates</a></p></li></ul><p>House Democrats released <a href="https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fo/e7n5g4wz0cjngv9u9qys2/AHNOf8vcSNtejTpIcQGaICs?dl=0&amp;e=1&amp;preview=IMG_9221_Redacted.pdf&amp;rlkey=c8fds6c4a8t6zwoiglx4c7kt3&amp;st=16dpmuw0">a handful of photos and videos</a> from Jeffrey Epstein’s private Caribbean island on Wednesday, offering a rare glimpse into a secretive place where Epstein is alleged to have trafficked young girls.</p><p>The new images and videos show Epstein’s home, including bedrooms, a telephone, what appears to be an office or library, and a chalkboard on which the words “fin”, “intellectual”, “deception” and “power” are written. One photo shows a room with a dentist chair and masks hanging on the wall. The New York Times <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/28/business/jeffrey-epstein-island.html">reported</a> that Epstein’s last girlfriend was a dentist who shared an office with one of his shell companies. The videos appear to be a walk-through of the property.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/dec/03/epstein-caribbean-island-new-photo-video-release">Continue reading...</a>
